clusters.title: The decline in healthy life expectancy in Britain should shock us all | Letters
clusters.neutral_headline: The decline in healthy life expectancy in Britain should shock us all

items.title: The decline in healthy life expectancy in Britain should shock us all | Letters
items.standfirst: Alan Walker and Ian Garner respond to the news that healthy life expectancy of both women and men has fallenThe decline in healthy life expectancy (HLE) is so momentous it should have ejected the former prince from the front page (Female healthy life expectancy falls three years, print edition, 20 February). The shocking fall of three years for women and two years for men, in just three years, reveals the cumulative impact of the Tory/Liberal Democrat austerity programme and the gross mismanagement of the pandemic.In contrast to the lowest HLE since these figures were first estimated (2011-13), Swedish HLE has continued to rise and is an average of five years higher than the UK’s. It is blindingly obvious that unless the government urgently prioritises extending HLE, it cannot hope to stem the flow of older workers out of the labour market.Alan WalkerEmeritus professor of social policy and social gerontology, University of Sheffield Continue reading...
items.content: Alan Walker and Ian Garner respond to the news that healthy life expectancy of both women and men has fallenThe decline in healthy life expectancy (HLE) is so momentous it should have ejected the former prince from the front page (Female healthy life expectancy falls three years, print edition, 20 February). The shocking fall of three years for women and two years for men, in just three years, reveals the cumulative impact of the Tory/Liberal Democrat austerity programme and the gross mismanagement of the pandemic.In contrast to the lowest HLE since these figures were first estimated (2011-13), Swedish HLE has continued to rise and is an average of five years higher than the UK’s. It is blindingly obvious that unless the government urgently prioritises extending HLE, it cannot hope to stem the flow of older workers out of the labour market.Alan WalkerEmeritus professor of social policy and social gerontology, University of Sheffield Continue reading...

clusters.title: Spotting a peacenik by the newspaper they read | Brief letters
clusters.neutral_headline: Spotting a peacenik by the newspaper they read

items.title: Spotting a peacenik by the newspaper they read | Brief letters
items.standfirst: Guardian policing | Going commando | Underwear shrinkage | Talking to strangers | Leg stoma bagsSome years ago, my sons travelled with Aston Villa supporters going to Wolves. A young policeman picked them out at the railway station along with others to be shepherded to the ground. But an older sergeant advised the constable: “Not those two – that one’s got a Guardian under his arm.” How’s that for peacenik recognition? Non-bearded, they weren’t even wearing sandals.David Drew Birmingham• There’s a simple solution for those concerned with running their washing machine at 60C to wash underwear or risking contamination (Letters, 24 February) – take the military option and go commando.Dr Bob Aron Ilkley, West Yorkshire Continue reading...
items.content: Guardian policing | Going commando | Underwear shrinkage | Talking to strangers | Leg stoma bagsSome years ago, my sons travelled with Aston Villa supporters going to Wolves. A young policeman picked them out at the railway station along with others to be shepherded to the ground. But an older sergeant advised the constable: “Not those two – that one’s got a Guardian under his arm.” How’s that for peacenik recognition? Non-bearded, they weren’t even wearing sandals.David Drew Birmingham• There’s a simple solution for those concerned with running their washing machine at 60C to wash underwear or risking contamination (Letters, 24 February) – take the military option and go commando.Dr Bob Aron Ilkley, West Yorkshire Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Guardian newspaper was a clue
Sandals were not a distinguishing feature
The incident occurred at a railway station

clusters.title: UK health official recuses himself from puberty blockers trial after bias claims
clusters.neutral_headline: UK health official recuses himself from puberty blockers trial after bias claims

items.title: UK health official recuses himself from puberty blockers trial after bias claims
items.standfirst: MHRA says Prof Jacob George will no longer be involved after gender-critical social media posts from last yearA health official who reportedly intervened to pause a clinical trial on the use of puberty blockers has been removed from any further involvement due to accusations of bias.Prof Jacob George, who was appointed chief medical and scientific officer at the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) in January, raised concerns that led to the Pathways trial being put on hold by the government, according to the Sunday Times. Continue reading...
items.content: MHRA says Prof Jacob George will no longer be involved after gender-critical social media posts from last yearA health official who reportedly intervened to pause a clinical trial on the use of puberty blockers has been removed from any further involvement due to accusations of bias.Prof Jacob George, who was appointed chief medical and scientific officer at the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) in January, raised concerns that led to the Pathways trial being put on hold by the government, according to the Sunday Times. ai_summary: Bias claims led to his removal

clusters.title: Touch, sound and style: how London fashion week is opening up to visually impaired guests – photo essay
clusters.neutral_headline: Touch sound and style how London fashion week is opening up to visually impaired guests

items.title: Touch, sound and style: how London fashion week is opening up to visually impaired guests – photo essay
items.standfirst: From live audio descriptions to fabric swatch booklets, designers including Chet Lo are rethinking the catwalk experience for blind and low-vision clothes-lovers ‘If you put your hands out and run your fingers along this skirt, you’ll feel that there are soft feathers appliquéd on to it,” says the fashion designer Chet Lo. “The skirt is emerald green in colour with black panels on the side and it is designed to be very fitted on the body.” Lo is speaking to a group of six guests ahead of his London fashion week show, offering them a sneak preview of his new collection that will shortly be unveiled on the catwalk.Chet Lo shows his Night Market collection at the Mandarin Oriental hotel at London fashion week Continue reading...

clusters.title: ‘All you need is a chair and a view’: could daily ‘dusking’ make us healthier and happier?
clusters.neutral_headline: Daily Dusking Promotes Health And Happiness

items.title: ‘All you need is a chair and a view’: could daily ‘dusking’ make us healthier and happier?
items.standfirst: An old Dutch ritual of going outside to watch the coming of night – or dusking – is having a revival across Europe. Fans of the practice say it’s a great way to disconnect from screens and find peace I’m wandering around a walled garden on the edge of the North York Moors at dusk. The darkening sky is faintly illuminated by a sharp sliver of crescent moon and the first stars. Bats are swooping in search of supper, an owl is softly hooting and the dark outline of a ruined castle looms beyond the walls.But what is really striking about the scene is what’s missing: artificial light. There are no solar lamps or electric bulbs; no torches or phone screens. As parts of the garden recede into the gloom, others are thrown into sharp relief: the bare branches of winter trees; a russet-coloured hedge; clumps of snowdrops, glowing bright in the moonlight. Continue reading...
items.content: An old Dutch ritual of going outside to watch the coming of night – or dusking – is having a revival across Europe. Fans of the practice say it’s a great way to disconnect from screens and find peace I’m wandering around a walled garden on the edge of the North York Moors at dusk. The darkening sky is faintly illuminated by a sharp sliver of crescent moon and the first stars. Bats are swooping in search of supper, an owl is softly hooting and the dark outline of a ruined castle looms beyond the walls.But what is really striking about the scene is what’s missing: artificial light. There are no solar lamps or electric bulbs; no torches or phone screens. As parts of the garden recede into the gloom, others are thrown into sharp relief: the bare branches of winter trees; a russet-coloured hedge; clumps of snowdrops, glowing bright in the moonlight. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Dusking is an old Dutch ritual

clusters.title: Jeremy Webb died of a meat allergy triggered by a tick bite. How do you avoid ticks and safely remove them?
clusters.neutral_headline: Tick Bites Can Trigger Meat Allergy

items.title: Jeremy Webb died of a meat allergy triggered by a tick bite. How do you avoid ticks and safely remove them?
items.standfirst: After a coroner concluded 16-year-old Australian died of a bite-induced meat allergy, we look at how to spot symptoms and preventative measuresFollow our Australia news live blog for latest updatesGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastMyfanwy Webb remembers her son Jeremy was “always getting ticks” because he spent a lot of time in the bush, camping and mountain bike riding, around the property where he grew up on the Central Coast of New South Wales.When Jeremy began to get really bad reactions to eating meat, or even when the scent wafted through the house if she was cooking a pork roast, Webb remembered reading an article about an immunologist who identified the connection between tick bites and developing mammalian meat allergy. Continue reading...
items.content: After a coroner concluded 16-year-old Australian died of a bite-induced meat allergy, we look at how to spot symptoms and preventative measuresFollow our Australia news live blog for latest updatesGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastMyfanwy Webb remembers her son Jeremy was “always getting ticks” because he spent a lot of time in the bush, camping and mountain bike riding, around the property where he grew up on the Central Coast of New South Wales.When Jeremy began to get really bad reactions to eating meat, or even when the scent wafted through the house if she was cooking a pork roast, Webb remembered reading an article about an immunologist who identified the connection between tick bites and developing mammalian meat allergy. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Tick bites can cause meat allergy
A coroner concluded a death was related

clusters.title: Why in the world is Melania Trump leading a UN security council meeting? | Arwa Mahdawi
clusters.neutral_headline: Melania Trump Leads UN Security Council Meeting

items.title: Why in the world is Melania Trump leading a UN security council meeting? | Arwa Mahdawi
items.standfirst: The first lady is a Trump and therefore automatically qualified to do anything her heart desires“We ended DEI in America,” Donald Trump boasted during his State of the Union (SOTU) address on Tuesday.Unlike many things the president said in his excruciatingly long SOTU speech, this was actually half true. The Trump administration’s “war on woke” has pushed a lot of large companies and institutes to retreat from the diversity, equity and inclusion policies they used to pretend to be proud of.Arwa Mahdawi is a Guardian columnist Continue reading...
items.content: The first lady is a Trump and therefore automatically qualified to do anything her heart desires“We ended DEI in America,” Donald Trump boasted during his State of the Union (SOTU) address on Tuesday.Unlike many things the president said in his excruciatingly long SOTU speech, this was actually half true. The Trump administration’s “war on woke” has pushed a lot of large companies and institutes to retreat from the diversity, equity and inclusion policies they used to pretend to be proud of.Arwa Mahdawi is a Guardian columnist Continue reading...

clusters.title: ‘Viruses don’t know borders’: US anti-vaccine rhetoric could impact global measles crisis

items.title: ‘Viruses don’t know borders’: US anti-vaccine rhetoric could impact global measles crisis
items.standfirst: Experts say global measles vaccination rates are falling as Trump officials signal a deprioritization of the virusThe US government has amplified anti-vaccine rhetoric and signaled that it does not consider measles to be a priority, which could have global ramifications as countries around the world have lost or are on the brink of losing measles elimination status.The World Health Organization announced in late January that six European countries: the United Kingdom, Spain, Austria, Armenia, Azerbaijan and Uzbekistan had all officially lost their measles elimination status, which means the virus has been circulating continuously in those countries for more than 12 months. In order to contain measles, at least 95% of children should be fully vaccinated against it, according to health recommendations, but vaccination rates have been falling across Europe. Continue reading...
items.content: Experts say global measles vaccination rates are falling as Trump officials signal a deprioritization of the virusThe US government has amplified anti-vaccine rhetoric and signaled that it does not consider measles to be a priority, which could have global ramifications as countries around the world have lost or are on the brink of losing measles elimination status.The World Health Organization announced in late January that six European countries: the United Kingdom, Spain, Austria, Armenia, Azerbaijan and Uzbekistan had all officially lost their measles elimination status, which means the virus has been circulating continuously in those countries for more than 12 months. In order to contain measles, at least 95% of children should be fully vaccinated against it, according to health recommendations, but vaccination rates have been falling across Europe. Continue reading...

clusters.title: ‘I clicked on a button – and everything changed’: how a DNA test turned my life upside-down

items.title: ‘I clicked on a button – and everything changed’: how a DNA test turned my life upside-down
items.standfirst: When I found out my father had been adopted, I was curious to know more about his side of the family. Nothing could have prepared me for what I would discover …Above my grandma’s bed hung a framed black‑and-white photograph of my dad. As a small child I quietly admired it; his luminous eyes, dark hair and gentle smile. He embodied a tender yet spirited early adulthood, staring into the future. Handsome and seeking.As I grew older, I would discover that it was not, in fact, a photograph of my dad but of a man called Elvis Presley. Apparently he was very famous. My grandma had been a lifelong fan. My parents laughed – an adorable mistake – but I felt a hot pulse of humiliation. Continue reading...
items.content: When I found out my father had been adopted, I was curious to know more about his side of the family. Nothing could have prepared me for what I would discover …Above my grandma’s bed hung a framed black‑and-white photograph of my dad. As a small child I quietly admired it; his luminous eyes, dark hair and gentle smile. He embodied a tender yet spirited early adulthood, staring into the future. Handsome and seeking.As I grew older, I would discover that it was not, in fact, a photograph of my dad but of a man called Elvis Presley. Apparently he was very famous. My grandma had been a lifelong fan. My parents laughed – an adorable mistake – but I felt a hot pulse of humiliation. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A DNA test revealed a secret

clusters.title: Poorly regulated clinics in England are putting children with ADHD at risk, warn doctors
clusters.neutral_headline: Poorly Regulated Clinics Put Children At Risk

items.title: Poorly regulated clinics in England are putting children with ADHD at risk, warn doctors
items.standfirst: Private providers accused of prescribing powerful stimulants without examining young patients properlyChildren with ADHD are being put at risk by poorly regulated private clinics that prescribe powerful stimulants without key physical examinations, doctors have warned.A surge in remote-only assessments has led to what one clinician described as “widespread and unsafe practice”, where children are being diagnosed and medicated via video link. The clinical warnings have now forced health authorities in Greater Manchester to overhaul prescribing rules, mandating face-to-face checks to protect the safety of children. Continue reading...
items.content: Private providers accused of prescribing powerful stimulants without examining young patients properlyChildren with ADHD are being put at risk by poorly regulated private clinics that prescribe powerful stimulants without key physical examinations, doctors have warned.A surge in remote-only assessments has led to what one clinician described as “widespread and unsafe practice”, where children are being diagnosed and medicated via video link. The clinical warnings have now forced health authorities in Greater Manchester to overhaul prescribing rules, mandating face-to-face checks to protect the safety of children. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Children with ADHD are at risk
